name: Easy Thai Fried Chicken Recipe
description: This easy Thai fried chicken recipe uses simple ingredients and is perfect with the included Thai sweet chili sauce.
recipeIngredient: 150 g crispy flour ((e.g. tempura flour) + extra for coating chicken before frying)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the chicken marinade by stirring together flour, salt, white pepper, chili sauce, rosdee seasoning powder, and egg in a mixing bowl. Add water and lime juice, then mix again until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the chicken marinade by stirring together flour, salt, white pepper, chili sauce, rosdee seasoning powder, and egg in a mixing bowl. Add water and lime juice, then mix again until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the chicken in the batter mix, coating each piece well. Marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours, or overnight for more flavor. Take the chicken out of the fridge 20 minutes before frying to help it cook evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the chicken in the batter mix, coating each piece well. Marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours, or overnight for more flavor. Take the chicken out of the fridge 20 minutes before frying to help it cook evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Have your bowl of crispy flour ready. Before frying, roll the chicken in the crispy flour for an even layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Have your bowl of crispy flour ready. Before frying, roll the chicken in the crispy flour for an even layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a frying pan to 350°F to 375°F (175°C to 190°C). Fry the coated right away, making sure not to crowd the pan. Flip the chicken until it’s golden brown and crispy. Serve your Thai crispy chicken hot!
